text: It is good for the US to finally have a National Cyber Strategy in place to secure critical networks, effectively deter & respond to bad actors, & protect our economy while promoting a free and open internet. This has been a significant need for years.
Today on #POWMIARecognitionDay, we remember & honor our POWs & those who never returned home. We will never forget their service & sacrifice to our nation.

September 18-24 is Opioid and Heroin Awareness Week. As #OK families continue to feel the effects of the #OpioidEpidemic, we all must take an active role to assist families that are directly impacted by the devastation of opioid abuse. https://t.co/AeHm3qhCla

More than one year since I wrote this, and it’s still true today. Focusing on trade deficits doesn’t help American workers or families. The US should be focused instead on opening up new markets and forging new trade deals that will benefit all Americans. https://t.co/EQMzira340

.@ChadPergram I have supported Kavanaugh since I questioned him for an hour in my office in July. He was straightforward and committed to the law. Like everyone else, I will pay close attention to the Thurs hearing to learn any new info, but my support for his nom has not changed https://t.co/dzffd1Gqgq

It’s always great to welcome Oklahomans visiting DC to my office for #JavawithJames – a constituent coffee I host in my office at 9 a.m. on Wednesdays when the Senate is in session. https://t.co/6XMkpiVxYc

Freedom of religion is the core of who we are as a nation. It’s our fundamental right to live out our faith or have no faith at all. It’s incredible to see so many young people gather in prayer at @SeeYouAtThePole events across Oklahoma & the US. #SYATP https://t.co/IB8qMW5KBZ

This week, we pause to honor the Gold Star families that have lost a loved one while serving our nation. Thank you to our Gold Star families; your sacrifice cannot be measured.

Like DACA, border security, and so many other areas, this is an important reform to our immigration system. Congress should stop kicking the can down the road & act now. https://t.co/BmcKaXp1yV

It is again my great honor to welcome and thank Oklahoma veterans during their Honor Flight visit to DC. I am grateful for their service, commitment, and sacrifice to our nation to protect and preserve our values and freedom. Thank you. https://t.co/S2UUF6odKg

Today, the Senate passed the bipartisan #FAA Reauthorization Act. Oklahoma plays a key role for the FAA through hosting the Mike Monroney Aeronautical Center in #OK. I'm pleased the 5-year reauthorization provides stability for the operation of the center.
https://t.co/L8ogU88KuL

Today’s announcement that unemployment rates have dropped to the lowest we’ve seen since 1969 & more jobs continue to be added is great news for our nation and Oklahoma. #JobsReport https://t.co/DTJx82GdUY

Listen to the recent episode of my podcast as I break down the nomination of Judge Kavanaugh to #SCOTUS.

https://t.co/HjmuP6oY5s

#OK is home to a number of great manufacturing companies like @HemSaw, that employee hardworking men and women. On #MFGDay18 we celebrate entrepreneurs, innovators, workers, and the next generation of manufacturers. https://t.co/GODWEr31vv

You may have seen reports that @lisamurkowski will vote present to "pair" her vote with @stevedaines who is walking his daughter down the aisle. Here's a quick explanation on what that means: https://t.co/x8fo7Bwvlf

Judge Kavanaugh is qualified to serve on #SCOTUS. He has a strong record as a judge, & he has served his legal & local community well through his instruction at law schools, service to the homeless, mentorship of young law clerks, and as a coach of his daughter’s bball team.

(2/5) In July, he started what he thought would be a typical nomination process for a #SCOTUS Justice. He met with Senators one-on-one, testified for 3 days in front of the Judiciary Committee, and submitted more than 480,000 documents including from his previous time in the WH. https://t.co/JqlIohRN4L

(3/5) The Judiciary Committee conducted a diligent investigation in light of several additional allegations against Judge Kavanaugh and neither they or the FBI was able to find evidence to support the multiple accusations against him. https://t.co/615f5Qi8GO

(4/5) I spent 22 years in youth ministry working with students and families. There is no question in my mind about the hurt, the pain, and the fear of those who have endured sexual assault. https://t.co/XEtfUpg7mM

(5/5) People need to be believed and taken seriously. When information comes out, we have to make decisions based on the facts in front of us. I pray for our nation as we heal from this difficult time. https://t.co/fBeWklN0wt

I’m thankful for @nikkihaley's remarkable work as US Ambassador to the UN. She has done an excellent job. She has been a reformer and has led with tenacious strength. Through her leadership, she addressed issues that have been ignored at the UN for far too long.
Fall tornado warnings and strong storms across #OK today. Keep an eye on the storms & stay weather aware. #OKWX https://t.co/qpnmcrtKrS
Praying for those in the path of #HurricaneMichael. I am grateful to the teams at @FEMA and @NWS for helping affected areas prepare.

Great to chat with @MichaelJMorell on faith, the Intel Community, safeguarding the nation’s cybersecurity, and my work on election security. Click below to listen to the podcast. https://t.co/2ZSLoaI7Oo
Joined @KTULNews from DC to discuss major news of the day. https://t.co/kNyG7ekhi8
Earlier today I questioned @SecNielsen and FBI Director Wray during a Senate Homeland Security hearing to examine threats to the homeland. Click --> to watch. https://t.co/3QggfBVCg6

I joined @ericbolling yesterday to discuss a number of issues including the recent disappearance of Washington Post journalist Jamal Khsohoggi after visiting the Saudi consulate in Istanbul, Turkey. https://t.co/uNQz9a7kNW

It is always my honor to meet with the Oklahoma State Fire Marshal Ambassador Group. Thank you, men and women, for your great service. Not just across our great state, but also on the East Coast assisting in hurricane relief efforts from #HurricaneFlorence. https://t.co/6CGPSgCTTL

I am thankful Pastor Brunson is coming home after being detained in Turkey for two years. I continue to pray for the Brunson family as this has been a long and painful journey. 

https://t.co/4BKElPDIy8
Pastor Brunson is on his way home! https://t.co/3HZuj3oi92

Joining @Morning_Joe & @SenatorShaheen now to discuss Pastor Brunson’s return to the US after being detained in Turkey for two years.
I was able to spend some time today w/ volunteers at the @RFBO, meeting with @CCAOKC and connecting with students at Santa Fe South High School. https://t.co/bYRr5M5BBA

Today, I visited with Yukon Public Schools 7th & 8th grade students as they work on their project for CSPAN’s 2019 @StudentCam documentary competition. I can also confirm the fire alarm is fully operational, since it made itself known during our conversation in history class. 🚒 https://t.co/IYQ9h68UTn

October is #NationalPrincipalsMonth. It was my honor to meet with Oklahoma’s High School Principal of the Year, Kim Coody, last month. Thank you to all of OK’s principals for the work you do on a day-to-day basis to best serve our students. https://t.co/9Mv7SR2nes

One week ago, Pastor Andrew Brunson was released after being unjustly detained for two years in Turkey. We need to continue to move forward until every American who is wrongfully detained in Turkey is released. #FBF https://t.co/NAsjJ3eOlA

October is National Cybersecurity Awareness Month. There are tools every Oklahoman can use to protect their families and raise awareness. Visit https://t.co/XMPYxgO95z for additional resources to stay safe and secure online. https://t.co/JnbcR1vic1

Great to visit w/ employees & tour the new 60,000-sq. ft. @Amazon Delivery Facility in OKC w/ @RepRussell today. We’re excited for the new job opportunities & expanded delivery options for OK customers. https://t.co/8xPVQiWp5b

Honored to attend the 21st Annual Clergy Appreciation lunch and have the opportunity to present both @JimInhofe & @RepRussell w/ the Statesman of the Year award. These men live out their faith in their work in OK & DC with grace & excellence in their service to the people of OK. https://t.co/Q6ulsrCuqW

Dropped by @pelcoproducts w/ @RepRussell today to tour the facility and get a chance to connect w/ workers to discuss the impact of tariffs on hiring, immigration issues, & more. https://t.co/smFmto1sDO

Honored to receive the @NFIB Guardian of Small Business award in Edmond this morning. During the last two years, I have worked to roll back federal regulations, which helps OK small businesses drive economic growth. https://t.co/YvecBfgUKJ

My heart is broken for the Jewish families who were attacked while praying at Pittsburgh’s Tree of Life Synagogue this morning. Please join me in prayer for these families and the brave first responders who rushed to protect them.

Today is the 20th anniversary of the International Religious Freedom Act. Freedom to have a faith and live it out or have no faith at all is a basic human right. On #InternationalReligiousFreedomDay we remember & pray for those who are oppressed for their faith around the world. https://t.co/aOQZiZODGr
Thanks for having me on this morning, @PC1170. https://t.co/gYtzXrStUb

Had a great day in Broken Arrow. Spent time with a business round table @BAChamber, lunch with @BA_Police & BA FD, met w/ VA & hospital leaders to discuss veteran health in Tulsa, and toured @GatherTulsa. https://t.co/S12T8d0joZ

Pleased @WhirlpoolCorp has expanded its Tulsa distribution center. The project will create 150 additional jobs & add manufacturing & distribution capacity. I am grateful to continue to see job creation & business growth in OK. https://t.co/aaSRPaaQBA

Spent the day in NE OK learning about the important work at Light of Hope Ministries, participating in a Q&A w/the Catoosa Chamber, hearing from Catoosa HS students & faculty, & talking through veteran issues at the Claremore DAV. https://t.co/Phn2a9moWq
Enjoyed meeting the fine staff at Claremore’s @ChickfilA yesterday! Impressed w/the process of how they make my favorite sandwich, the #1. https://t.co/IpkNk9BMnE

This week is National Veterans Small Business Week. Thank you to the veteran-owned businesses that employ more than 5 million people. These men & women selflessly served & defended our nation in uniform & now apply their skillset as business owners. #vetbiz

As the Admin & Congress continue to work to protect our elections, you too can help by getting election information straight from the source &checking for reliable info. Click to read more--> https://t.co/6uwo6TzdEH

Nov is Critical #Infrastructure #Security & Resilience Month. The US faces constant cyber & infrastructure threats, we must continue to build on securing networks, deterring bad actors, & protecting our economy. https://t.co/LYFqoVgDo9

Congrats to Americom Technologies Group in Owasso and Mayhew Technology Solutions in Edmond, for being awarded the HIRE Vets Medallion Program Demonstration Award. This award highlights their efforts in hiring & recruiting veterans in our state. Congratulations!  #hirevets https://t.co/UklUEx1SQi
My thoughts on @POTUS proclamation to address migration at the southern border--> https://t.co/Y8WJarQJAi

Happy #Bedlam weekend, @OU_Football & @CowboyFB. May the best team win… #GoPokes #BoomerSooner @CollegeGameDay

Last year, 2,593 kids were adopted in Oklahoma. #OrphanSunday is a time to say thank you to those who have helped unite families and to remember that thousands of children are still looking for their #ForeverFamily.
I am grateful for church and community members who will not quit until every child has a safe and loving home. https://t.co/4uEd46dRYq

I am grateful for the veterans living and serving in OK who have worn the cloth of our nation in defense of liberty. We live in freedom as a direct result of their sacrifice, and we will never be able to thank them and their families enough. #VeteransDay https://t.co/qTyKrGiDQv
Welcome to the OK congressional delegation, Rep. Kevin Hern. Look forward to serving with you! https://t.co/L5CR5umNwI
Hosting #JavawithJames with several constituents this morning in DC. During your next trip to DC, be sure to stop by my office on Wed at 9am for Java! https://t.co/35KMxVly4n

I’m speaking at the @NatImmForum  Leading the Way series this morning to discuss how Congress can approach immigration reform in a bipartisan way. You can watch the live stream HERE: #LeadingtheWay18     
https://t.co/PdcKfTqKll

In April, @LeaderMcConnell appointed me to the Joint Select Committee on Budget & Approps Reform to make significant changes to the way we pass a budget. Today, we will discuss a proposed bill to make changes to the current process. To watch live: https://t.co/ADU1Bn9QDQ

Our broken immigration system affects millions of families and our economy. Now is the time to work together to solve issues with #DACA, border security, asylum, TPS, and more.  https://t.co/93W5wDEE9k https://t.co/afJDlBGEuy

Our charge by law is to “significantly reform the budget and appropriations process.” That doesn’t mean tinker around the edges of reform – that means go big. Let’s fix the budget mess once and for all. https://t.co/3coyTmJATa

We aren’t going to get a better budget until we get a better process. This bill addresses biannual budgeting, but there is still so much more we should do. I will continue to push for budget reform solutions https://t.co/c4fZLUgdO1

Let’s require Congress to do regular deficit reduction. We do approps every yr, but we do not address long-term debt and deficit issues. Debt ceiling doesn't work. We continue to raise it& we never reign in debt. Let’s replace it& make Congress consider deficit reduction pkges https://t.co/Oy9nmgKrfv
Congress should have certain penalties when it fails to complete its basic functions to pass a budget and the essential funding bills that follow https://t.co/JAicf8sC5K

Let’s make the budget a law—right now it’s only a “guiding” document for Congress. Making it law gives an enforceable budget levels that can help prevent gov’t shutdown threats making the budget fight happen on the front end https://t.co/ajjpDK92A2

We have 12 appropriations bills that address spending, but we don’t have a bill that addresses saving. I propose we add a 13th bill to address ways to save – a deficit reduction bill. I proposed 2 amendments today that would do this. https://t.co/42wCOaV6r2

If we want to make significant changes, we must put forward bold solutions that reduce debt and deficits, prevents gov’t shutdowns, and make the process far more transparent to the American people. Click to watch my full speech: https://t.co/lVNsGCFtlE https://t.co/r1W2YngviC

Today marks 111 years of OK statehood. Adversity may have tested us over the years, but it has never knocked us down. Our OK Standard remains strong in our enduring spirit to lift up our families to a better future. https://t.co/8wtLNu5yM3

Congratulations to @tricountytech on receiving the 2018 Baldridge National Quality Award for their leadership and innovation in their community and in our state. This recognition is well deserved, and we are blessed to have Tri-Co Tech in OK.
Happy Birthday, @JimInhofe! It is an honor to serve our great state alongside you.
